title: Papahānaumokuākea Marine National Monument
summary: The Papahānaumokuākea Marine National Monument (roughly /pɑːpɑːˈhɑːnaʊmoʊkuˌɑːkeɪ.ə/[2]) is a World Heritage listed U.S. National Monument encompassing 583,000 square miles (1,510,000 km2) of ocean waters, including ten islands and atolls of the Northwestern Hawaiian Islands. Created in June 2006 with 140,000 square miles (360,000 km2), it was expanded in August 2016 by moving its border to the limit of the exclusive economic zone,[1] making it one of the world's largest protected areas. It is internationally known for its cultural and natural values as follows:
